page.title: 04INDUSTRY IN WILLENHALL TODAY
page.content: The traditional metal based industries of lock and key manufacture and similar light engineering factories still exist but there has been a steady decline in recent years. Computer technology has advanced, working conditions have improved but many jobs have been lost. Parents are worried about employment prospects for school leavers and adults. Some people attribute a rise in teenage crime and drug abuse to unemployment. Fears are expressed that national and local government are not creating job opportunities in areas of new technology. Amongst other reasons,bad planning is seen as a cause of a fall in the general living standard. Some work has been created by government but,although designed as useful training it is seen by some as low grade, temporary employment.
